intro: Matricaria grandis, commonly known as the large chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flower heads and white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, producing a mild, citrus-like scent. Matricaria grandis is often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
